intro: Campyloneurum majus, commonly known as the giant moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its large, sprawling growth habit and its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a distinctive leaf structure with a broad, undulating margin and a central midrib. It is often found in temperate regions, particularly in forest floors and rocky crevices. Its ecological role includes contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for microorganisms.
